text: Piwo brunatne, piany brak. Aromat sÅ‚odki, suszone owoce (rodzynki, daktyle), przyjemny karmel, gÅ‚adki, trochÄ™ krÃ³wkowy. W tle nuty wanilii i kokosa. W smaku bardzo peÅ‚en, sÅ‚odkie, likierowe. karmel, melasa, suszone owoce w cukrze, wanilia i kokos w posmaku, do tego finisz kojarzÄ…cy siÄ™ z rumem. Genialne!
No head, no co2. Cane sugar, oxidation, very sweet, really great. Perfectly hidden alcohol

Versione 2013. Si presenta come un puro liquore, ambra marrone senza schiuma. Al naso eccezionale Aroma di caramello, vinosa, evidente linvecchiamento. Superba al palato con una grande complessitÃ  di dark fruits, caramello, dolce e rotonda seppur non impegnativa, marsala, zibibbo, porto. Carbonazione assente, alcol non fastidioso, consistenza oleosa. Da degustazione a sorsi per la sua grandezza.

Sampled from a 0.75l 2011 model bottle @ Proletariat. A near clear one as far as I can tell, not head at all and itÂ’s oak-amber in color, I think as itÂ’s kinda dark here. Lovely oxidized aroma. ItÂ’s really nutty infused, a ton of sweet raisins, thick syrupy caramel sauce, Vanilla, hints of wood and Norwegian brown cheese thatÂ’s been soaked in a little bit of chloride. The last part probably from rinsing the glass. Like what I smell. Oh, itÂ’s his is good. Fudgy caramel and a lovely sherry sweetness. ThereÂ’s a few bubbles that prickles on the tongue and itÂ’s thick and syrupy in the mouth. Warming, dry licorice, Vanilla, apples and sweet concentrate of oranges. Wow. Ã… flavor bomb! 19.06.2015

Oct. Â’16. A 0.5 l bottle, vintage 2010. It poured a clear copper body with prominent, thicker legs. Sweetish dried fruit aroma, caramel, nuts, some alcohol and wood. Moderately sweet flavor, not too overwhelming although still cloying, malty with more dried and ripe fruits, sherry and then nuts mixing up with a strong wood barrel note. Light sourness popped in here and there. Full bodied of course with tingling sweetish and warming alcohol finish following the flavor. Not so extremely slow going as some from this series, but also complex although the barrel seemed to round it in expense of both sweetness and complexity. A good, serious stuff.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2017 2008 Bottle on balcony at San Vito Lo Capo, Sicily, 3rd June 17.  Pours dark brown black, aroma is dark fruit, caramel, Marsala wine, sweetish, rich, delicious.  CanÂ’t believe this is beer.

Bottle, 2011 vintage. Pours an absolutely headless, slightly murky brown beer. The full on aroma of wood, cinnamon, vanilla, lots of caramel, slight amount of booze. Lots of wood, lots of caramel and lots of cookies spices. Flavor is very sweet, lots of spices, amazing amount of caramel, dark red fruits, sweet fruits. The full on light spicy sweetness is just amazing. Perfectly balanced, full flavored, long aftertaste. SIlky mouthfeel, no carbonation. But still this is just amazing and I want to drink this all day.

Bottle pour at Baladin Bologna. Huge caramel and toffee nose, creme caramel. Again huge caramel cream and vanilla in the flavor. Slightly cloying and candy-like, at least compared to the Fume. Very soft, awesome body, though a bit more sugary. Caramel apples. Good but too sweet. Less balanced. This is a great beer, but the Fume was just so much more exquisitely balanced.

Zdecydowanie najlepsze BW jakie miaÅ‚em przyjemnoÅ›Ä‡ piÄ‡. Barwa bardzo ciemno-herbaciana, wysycenie praktycznie zerowe, piwo mocno oblepia szkÅ‚o. W zapachu rodzynki, miÃ³d pitny, figi, delikatny rum, wiÅ›nie i palony cukier. W smaku... ileÅ¼ tu siÄ™ dzieje... Znowu duÅ¼o miodu pitnego i rodzynek, fajna sÅ‚odyczka, karmel i trochÄ™ waniliowej krÃ³wki, na drugim planie gra wanilia i syrop klonowy. Alkohol trochÄ™ wyczuwalny ale zupeÅ‚nie w niczym nie przeszkadza. PiÅ‚em je cztery razy po kapkÄ™ przez miesiÄ…c przy dobrze zakorkowanej butelce (korek ktÃ³ry wypompowuje powietrze). CaÅ‚y czas byÅ‚o wyborne.

Vintage 2010. Bottle @ Dobry Zbeer. Brown, little hazy, no head of course. Insane aroma: barrel, rum, cherry, toast, vanilla, biscuits, almonds, figs, wood. Inceredibly oily, flat. Long pleasant aftertaste. Alcohol perfectly warming throat. Little bit worse than fume, but still nearly perfect barley wine.

Bottle, vintage 2011. Pours clear dark maroon, with no head at all. Aroma is dark fruits with raisins and prunes, tobacco and wooden barrels. Medium to creamy body, with no carbonation whatsoever. Flavour is dark fruits with rum raisins, prunes and notes of cherries, leather, raw cocoa and wooden barrels. Close to a missing link between sherry and madeira wine. Incredibly smooth and complex, yet balanced and drinkable. Brilliant!

Sample from bottle at Uiltje bar. Very dark brown with no head. Thick complex body with almost no carbonation. Very sweet with subtle bitter tones. Plums, raisin, caramel, sugar and spices. Very Â’portÂ’-ish brew, good!

@les Trentenaires; courtesy of Aurelien Millet; 2010 vintage - clear rubby-brown beer, no foam; aroma of nuts, cherry and wood; madeireized; pretty sweet, no carbonation; long woody and nutty finish with a warming alcohol presence
Sample form the importer. This is more like sweet wine. Full bodied, no carbonation. best with deserts.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupeÅ‚niania profilu na ratebeer. Zerowe wysycenie, masa karmelu, fig, suszonych owocÃ³w i drewna. Znakomite piwo.

500ml bottle from boxbeers,com / Vintage 2011


Mahongy colour with no head. Overdone fruits, caramel, sweeeet, rum. Good indeed but 500ml is bit too much for one person.
From a bottle brewed in 2008. Pours a deep mahogany with zero head. Aroma of caramel. Flavors of plums, raisins, candi sugar, and caramel. Complex and delicious.
Bottle. Pours flat dark murky brown, no head. Notes of heavy oak, booze, whiskey, spice, caramel, malt, dark chocolate, prunes, raisins.

50 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden orange to brown with a small to fully gone head. Aroma is ffruity and dark toasted malty flavoured. Sweet, toasted malty and sweet caramelish. Smooth and sweet finish.

Sherry colored. Aroma of deep dark fruits - figs, prunes, tobacco bread. A touch boozy and sweet, but really cool. 
Shared bottle from I donÂ’t know where.
Bottle.Dark reddish colour with no head.Aroma is sweet and warming with flavor of dark dried fruits,most like dates and figs,nice vinious mouthfeels ad slight oily,well balanced and smooth finish.

September 4, 2015. Bottle, vintage 2011. 
Dark reddish amber with no head. Aroma is intense molasses, caramel, dark sugars, walnut, figs, prunes, rum, port, some vanilla and oak. Taste is very sweet without being cloying, very soft bitterness and some warming rum notes. Finish sweet malty notes of molasses, dates, prunes, port wine and some warming rum notes. Full bodied, thick oily texture, no carbonation. 
Amazing!

Pours dark bronze with absolutely no head. Aroma is incredible and incredibly rich; plums, caramel, sticky toffee, raisins, distinctive rum notes, cherries, and a hint of booze. Thick mouthfeel, like having a dissolved sweet or molasses in your mouth. Flavour is rich, incredibly complex and very layered. ThereÂ’s treacle and toffee, honey, plums, raisins, hints of vanilla even, which accompany the rich sweetness of the beer. Is similar to port/sherry and mead in its sweet flavour, but has some, though they are few, beer attributes like a somewhat earthy bitter note towards the end (almost not noticeable due to the sweetness). Finishes medium dry and a little bitter, mostly sweet. This is a very nice beer, unique and extremely tasty, to be enjoyed in small quantities. Amazing.

This beer does not really taste like a beer - it is silky smooth in taste and aroma, reminds me of mead (and honey in general) and dessert wine in that it is very sweet, very drinkable and seems light - almost no alcohol is detectable, the aftertaste is just more sweetness.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2016 Bottle [emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Locale, Copenhagen - (2011 vintage) dark brown Amber pour with tiny beige head. Aroma and taste is complex with a plethora of dark dried fruit, some caramel, treacle, rum soaked wooden nuances, deep rich and satisfying, lovely.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From notes. Enjoyed this at DougÂ’s house for a small gathering on May 01 with Travis, ebone1988, and I think Charlie made an appearance as well. Doug cracked this 750 mL bottle of 2010 out as a little bit of a break, and we all took a finger pour of it. Hot damn! The pour is a darker caramel colored golden brown with no head or carbonation. This thing looks delicious. The aroma is beautiful. There is a lot of toffee and butterscotch. The sweetness is really surprising. There is a nice oak to it as well as a maple and brown sugar sweetness. There is a little more booze than I would like, but thatÂ’s about the only thing I could knock this one on. The flavor has a lot of dark fruits and a heavy caramel and sweet butterscotch. The oakiness is good, and there is a little booze once again. The vanilla opens up a touch, and a maple sweetness and soft woodiness really shine through. The mouth feel is thick and chewy, even without any carbonation. The aftertaste is all sweet butterscotch, light fruits, and booze. ItÂ’s excellent. I wasnÂ’t expecting this one at all.

Bottle @ home. Pours with a deep red colour, absolutely no head whatsoever. Aroma is extremely fruity, including, but not limited to, grapes, red fruit, woodberries and a hundred other fruits; a little faint, but itÂ’s ok from a barley wine. Taste is extremely sweet, very little bitter; not at all balanced, but I really enjoy it. Medium body, oily texture, absolutely flat carb. Quite an extreme "beer", I can understand if somebody hates it; but I found it to be quite an astounding one. Mother of all barley wines!

Dark mahogany and very full-bodied, if not thick. Wonderful intensely sweet and fruity aroma, a rich flavour dominated by raisins, prunes and rum, with a port wine-like character, and a very sweet taste. There is no trace of bitterness or carbonation - or the alcohol, which is quite impressive. Overall, this beer is highly vinous and very tasty, but besides the sweetness it is also relative mild and not very complex. I enjoyed the 8 cl I drank, but more than that would quickly have become cloying, and I would need to lower my grade accordingly.

Bottle shared with koleminer20, Travis, and Doug. Aroma is caramel, toffee, sweet, English candy, butterscotch, make wow. Appearance is brown, no head, clear. Taste is sweet, butterscotch candy, caramel, toffee, slight heat, wow. Mouthfeel is medium body, no carbonation, butterscotch aftertaste. Overall, this is so so good.

2010 bottle acquired at Baladin Bologna, shared at a tasting. Pours copper with no head or carbonation. Aroma of caramel, candied sugar and light red fruit. Taste is heavily sweet, syrupy with dried sweet grapes. Highly vinous and very odd. Just extremely sweet and not so much else.
Bottle at Cara B. Copper colour with no head. Caramel, malt, black fruits, rum aroma. Sweet, caramel, brown sugar, malt, dark fruits, rum taste. Medium to full body.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 Style et rÃ©sumÃ©:  Extra strong ale barriquÃ© de grande qualitÃ© vendu hors de prix.
Comment: Un verre au Saint-Bock. Version 2011. 
Portrait:  Une robe brune ambrÃ©e translucide sans mousse ou pÃ©tillement. Un nez oxydÃ© boisÃ© avec du caramel, cassonade, mÃ©lasse, rhum ambrÃ©e, des fruits sÃ©chÃ©s et confits. LÃ©gÃ¨re vapeur dÂ’alcool. Une bouche chaleureuse oÃ¹ lÂ’alcool disparait, aucune lourdeur. Le liquide est sirupeux et lÃ©gÃ¨rement sucrÃ©. Plus prÃ¨s des Amontillado ou dÂ’un Palo Cortado que de nÂ’importe quelle biÃ¨re. Tout simplement superbe. 
Note:  9/10

Bottle. Aroma is so intense. Rich dense fruit, rum, maple, oak, and raisins. Tastes extremely sweet but so smooth. Almost mead like. Syrupy mouthfeel. So much dense fruit, maple and oak. Very unique and delicious. Love it.

PartagÃ©e en compagnie de Mettew au St-Bock. Cheers my friend! Le liquide ne crÃ©e aucune mousse lors du service. Le liquide quÂ’on me sert de cette bouteille de 500ml au coÃ»t de 60$ est ambrÃ©, cristallin et profond. On mÂ’aurait servi un vieux Porto Tawny que je nÂ’aurais Ã©tÃ© plus surpris. Aucune mousse; un alcool. Des arÃ´mes vanillÃ©s, du tabac, un caramel, de la crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, un malt doux et une sagesse dÂ’exÃ©cution inÃ©galÃ©e. Le paroxysme du savoir-faire. De la biÃ¨re? Je ne sais plus. Cette concoction me porte au-delÃ  de tout! Le liquide est chaud, prÃ©cieux, intelligent. De sa rondeur parfaite Ã©manent toutes les arÃ´mes vanillÃ©s dÂ’une crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e accompagnÃ©e dÂ’un cigare roulÃ© Ã  la main. Plus proche du Porto que de la biÃ¨re, cette boisson me rend fou. Ã€ quand la prochaine bouteille? Ã€ quand mon prochain voyage en Italie?

500 ml. bottle. Thanks Mike! Pours a dark reddish brown with just the hint of a head. Aroma of fruit, malt, caramel, and rum. Taste is dark sweet fruit, caramel, rum, malt, and barrel. Very warning. Very nice to sip on.

Look: clear dark brown.

Aroma: dried sour cherries in alcohol, red vermuth, vanilla barrel notes.
Taste: sweet with light sourness.
Rich mstured flavour: sherry, desert wine, reisins, cognac.

Very good.

500, corked, capped, pringles can. Fancy. Pours an opaque dark ebony with no head or lace. Big heavily oxidized nose, showing lots of tawny port and dark jammy blackberry-ish cabernet notes. Creamy thick heavy body, minimal carb. Oxidation rolls through everything here, showing crazy deep tawny port notes over the top of blackberries, caramel, nougat, and almonds. Heavy sweet cloying finish. Glad to have split this one 6 ways, but loved every drop.

sample from bottle, poured a dark red to brown colour pretty flat. lotÂ’s of sweet dark fruits, sweet raisins, earthy figs, oak, sweet caramel, dried grapes, whisky, and earthy spirits. really good stuff. a real easy sipper

A reddish copper barleywine with no head. In aroma, sweet fruity caramel malt with loads of dark fruits, molasses, alcohol warmth, light rum barrel, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity caramel malt with loads of dark fruits, light peated notes, rum barrel, licorice, alcohol warmth, very nice. On tap at Bir & Fud.

2011 batch. Perfectly clear, copper and ruby color, no carbonation, no head. Amazing aroma, unbelievable rich. Notes of rum, cherry, wood, vanilla, even sweet chocolate. And alcohol in the back end. In taste itÂ’s so sweet, full of rum, raisins, vanilla, a bit of port wine. Alcohol is super pleasant, especially when it evaporate to the back of the nose. The aftertaste might be a bit longer - that is all I would change in this beer. Mouth feel is so perfect. Beer is so smooth and so velvety. Love it.

Bottle sample at Open Baladin Rome Italy 03.12.2015.Tsste with ippopotamo36 bro, Mortlach and cika Boban.2011 Version.Pour it dark color with no head.Aroma too sweet, alcohol too much maybe.Taste dried sweet fruits, vanilla, honey, wodden note.Ok tasty.

Pours a clear brown with no head and no lacing. Nose is of alcohol and caramel. Not bad but not really complex or refined. Taste is really sweet with all sorts of sugar flavors: caramel, brown sugar and even maple. 
Moderately boozy. Full body, no carbonation and a syrupy mouthfeel. Good but not mindblowing to me. Just a big, big barleywine.

Bottle 500ml.
Pours almost burgundy (reddish reflects) with no head. Some legs. Aroma is of porto, fruits, barley sugar, oxydation, alcohol. Taste is of maple toffee, barley sugar, fruits, molasses, alcohol. Palate: Full bodied. No serious carbonation. Overall: Good stuff. A sipper. Very complex and oxydized.

Bottle (500 ml) at tasting. Thanks to hackobock for this bottle! Clear amber with no hear nor lacing but leaving some legs on the glass. Aroma is intensely molasses forward with dried raisins, rum, port like earthy notes, oak and oxidation notes. Taste is sweet but not cloying with loads of molasses along port like earthiness, figs, dates, dried raisins, rum spiciness, some alcohol warmth and hints of vanilla. Full body. Soft carbonation. Oily and a bit liquorous mouthfeel. Mouth coating sweetness that helps to keep the alcohol warmth restrained and vice versa. This is one of the best Barley Wine I have had so far. The malt depth is absolutely incredible. The balance is pretty good despite the loads of molasses and the balance between sweetness and alcohol is pinpoint. The oxidation and port like notes gives a wonderful complexity to this beer. Wonderful sipper!

500ML Bottle, pours fully flat like the others of this extended aging barley-wine project. Maroon reddish brown. Looks like a pour of cognac. ah, dark fruit city. Raisin, clove, fig, grape and whiskey. Coats the tongue and sticks around. Loads of dark fruit. Identical to the aroma except the addition of vanilla, coconut and even more raisin. ItÂ’s sweet and certainly signs of oxidation but certainly still perfectly drinkable.

I donÂ’t want to like these but I donÂ’t love them for their unique-ness..I love them for how damn good they are

pours clear dark copper, burnt orange tint, without a head. loads of cloying maple, rum, plain barley sugars, doughy caramel, wood - soft tannins, sherry fruitiness, minerals. flat carbonation, full body - thick like a pedio infection; cloying maple-spicy finish. abc well integrated. not my type of barley wine - complex but eh.

Bottle. Clear copper pour, still. Aroma is really super rich, nice port, molasses, tons of raisins. Taste is sweet, rich, boozy, warming port flavor, lingering molasses finish, rhum. Palate is full bodied slick and mouth coating. Delicious.

no head no carbonation, smells of alcohol and dates its very sweet. brown amber like colour, tastes strong dates and hint of the rum and woodiness. finishes strong with ever lasting dates and grapes. unreal beer. one of the best IÂ’ve have had.

Bottle. Pours dark brown, no head, no carbonation, clear. Aroma is toffee, caramel, very sweet with dried fruits: prune, raisins, figs, then vanilla, rum, nuts. In taste very sweet (malty) but not clogging, a little bit like sweet wine or even a mead. Lots of barrel notes, vanilla, fruits, caramel. Lots of sherry like oxidation. The beer is very smooth, thick bodied, sweet finish. Great dessert, great beer (but so different than other).

OEC Festivus 2, 12/12/15, directly from the rum barrel.A rather still, somewhat murky, deep, dark mahogany with some very light chestnut hints on the edges.Oh hell yes, this is rich, complex and just incredibly aromatic. And what itÂ’s not is heavily boozey or dominated by the barrel. Ultra-rich toffee, caramel, some fig and prune...Vanilla and just a touch of lightly spicy rum, and yet at the same time, lightly buttery oak. Fruitiness is pretty reserved and IÂ’m shocked how little alcohol, or even anything resembling sharp esters, emerges.In the mouth itÂ’s sweet, itÂ’s syrupy, itÂ’s thick and thereÂ’s almost zero carbonation. But itÂ’s awesome. Powerful toffee, caramel and raisin but with a good deal of dryness coming from nutty barrel tannin, light vanilla, warming alcohol and a more dry, nutty, sherry-like note that must be the oxidation. Yep, itÂ’s sweet and syrupy, but the sweetness seems predominantly malt-driven, not adjunct-like (like the heavy candy sweetness from the turbinado sugar in PerrinÂ’s No Rules, for example).See, I can appreciate a good dessert beer. So there.
Bottle sample at owl farm. Rum in aroma and in sweet finish. Very smooth. No booziness, though alcohol warming. The barlywine.
woody, raisin, herbs, alcohol, leather, caramel, amber, clear, minimal head, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, sticky, flat, long finish,

Pours brown with no head at all. Aroma; caramel, oak and rum notes from the barrel, port wine, roasted malt and maple syrup. Flavours; resin, rum, caramel, vanilla, maple syrup with the touch of port wine.. A little to sweet in the long term..

Vintage bottle of three years of age. Classy (and expensive) bottle, I must say... Absolutely no head at all, deep and warm, beautiful copper colour, looks like a glass of orange liqueur or something alike. Strong aroma carried upwards by the alcohol, very liqueurish and rather Â’unbeeryÂ’, with impressions of sweet sherry, marmelade, brown rhum, white port, candied banana, some oaky tannins (vanilla), amaretto, honey, wet wood... Very sweet flavour, candyish even and notably liqueurish, honeyish as well, candied oranges and dito cherries, marzipan, almost cloying even; expectedly very vinous, oily mouthfeel, supple, sweet caramelly malts but covered in this much candied sweetness and alcohol, it feels more like some Â’beer liqueurÂ’ than a traditional barley wine; I even get a flash of Samuel Adams Utopias in some respects. Warming but gentle and well-functioning alcohol and a hint of drying Â’woodinessÂ’ wraps things up in the finish, but the liqueurish and honeyish sweetness lasts for a long time after that. Very interesting, classy barley wine, clearly made with great care and skill. Perhaps a bit too sweet to enjoy by itself: I think a beer like this best serves its purpose in a gastronomical context, as a Â’dÃ©gustifÂ’ after a rich meal, paired with blue cheese to counter the sweetness. If you look at this in that specific context, I must admit that this is extremely well done and I can easily see how many people here rate this as the best beer Italy has to offer.

Limpido color rame, glicerinato e senza schiuma. Dolce ed imponente al naso, caramello, mou, zucchero abbrustolito, frutta matura, legno da botte, spirito. Al palato Ã¨ rotonda, vellutata, dolce, bilanciata, fruttata, maltata, ricorda un cognac o uno sherry. Corpo pieno, equilibrata ed imponente.

ok,certamente questo Ã¨ uno dei prodotti piÃ¹ lontani dalla normale concezione di birra..ma non si puÃ² negare lÂ’eccellente qualitÃ ..barley wine invecchiato in botti di rum cubano, spillato direttamente dalla botte di legno! aroma dominato dal rum e dallÂ’alcool..il sapore Ã¨ molto dolce,maltato e con finale di rum..gasatura pari allo zero..ferma e straordinariamente complessa..edizione single barrel 2010 Eurhop 2015

Clear dark brown reddish colour, no real head. Aroma of caramel, red grapes, banana, rum, wood and brown sugar. Sweet flavour, banana, caramel. Thick and sweet finish, brown sugar.(from draught @ GBBF Â’14, London. As Baladin Xyauya 2010 Rhum BA)
Deutlich alkoholischer, intensiv sÃ¼ÃŸer Antrunk. Dabei sehr weich, der Alkoholgehalt ist nur erahnbar. Whisky, sÃ¼ÃŸ, ausgewogen, holzig, harmonisch. 10/13/13/14//13

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2016 Botella, @Open Baladin, Roma. 23/09/2015. Botella 2012.
Color marrÃ³n oscuro, sabor malta, madera, pasas licor sutil, cuerpo denso. Espectaular
Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours brown/ black with no head. Smoke aroma. Sweet taste of oak and bourbon.
2010 bottle from BinnyÂ’s. Pours medium-brown with no head and a dark fruit aroma. There is a sweet raisin flavor with lots of dark molasses and an oak finish. Lots of rum too.

Bottle at Open Baladin Torino. Pours clear brown with no head. Aroma is sweet bready malt, brown sugar, maple, Sherry and dates. Flavor is sweet bready malt, sweet alcohol, dates, and a sweet finish. Full body and low carbonation. Drinks like a fine liquor.
Pours clear dark amber. Rich nose with alcohol presence. Sweet and malty. Rich... dried fruit and malt. No carbonation... phenomenal beer, If it is still considered beer. Delicious.

My last beer in Italy so this is a fitting one. Ruby red pour. thick nose of chocolate and dark fruits. tastes sherry, honey, toffee, light chocolate, plums, and cherries for sure. thick and sugary but very pleasant night cap to big time beer day. thanks to my new Italian friends for showing me around town and hosting me for tasting.

Bottle by Hackobock ! Thnx man ! 

Pours clear, dark and deep copper. Smell is bit boozy. Sweet, grainy, thick. Bit like a fine mead. Some honey notes and no carbo at all. Which is better for this one ! Love it !
LÃ¤tt dimmig, bÃ¤rnstens rÃ¶d. Doft: SÃ¶t mjÃ¶d, Madeira, hjortron, malt, alkohol, vanilj, trÃ¤, skogsblommor. Smak: Som doft fast Ã¤nnu godare. Lite sÃ¶t rom i eftersmaken.
In bottiglia. Aroma di legno, tostato, frutta secca, ossidato. al palato corpo intenso, piatta con sentori legnosi, e di frutta secca, ossidazione, nocciola, mandorla.
A: Dark amber/red no head. N: Fruity sherry, some plum, hint of fresh tobacco T: Sweet malty liqourice, fruity plum and apricot O: No carbo, very nice barley wine.

2010 Rum barrel for 18months. Bottle to glass. Pours a hazy thick light to medium brown character with zero head. Aroma is huge booze, molasses, dark fruits. Flavor is thicky, syrupy, sweet, surprisingly smooth. Delicious.

Hazy brown color with no head. Aroma is very complex, notes of caramel, honey, tabaco, chocolate, dark fruits like plum and alcohol. Flavor is too sweet like liquor or a Porto Wine, caramel and syrup notes, alcohol again present. No carbonation and full body with a sweet warm alcohol finish.

Aroma: intense malts, caramel, toffee, molasses, light oak. Appearance: clear brown, no head. Taste: heavy sweet. Palate: sweet, dark fruits, caramel, oily, heavy bread malts. Overall: very nice Barley Wine, excellent palate, nice fruitiness. Bottle at The Italian Job, Chiswick.

Good, if a bit too sweet. No head, no carbonation. Despite being 14%, no alcohol taste at all, only a warming effect. Rum, maple syrup, caramel, dried dark fruit, plum jam. So thick that it reminds of cough medicine a bit, but in a good way. Basically, more like a dessert wine than a beer. Works well with blue cheese.

Brown, transparent beer with a very little head that fastly disappears. Odour is great with hints of oak, raisins and chocolate-liqueur. The taste lives up to the fine odour with a taste of mead, chocolate and raisins combined with a good warm feeling and a perfect balance between sweetness and bitterness.

Pours a dark brown with hints of red. No head. Big boozy, fruity (grape skin, plum, date), and vanilla nose. Flavours were similar. Sweet flavours but despite the low IBU it wasnÂ’t cloying. Full bodied and warming. No carbonation level. IÂ’ve never tasted a beer like this. If I were told it was port, I would have believed it.

Draft at Open Baladin, Rome. Vanilla and maple notes, some caramel and grape skin. Rich rum caramel flavors, complex, sweet, coating. Slight medicinal quality, as it is basically uncarbonated. Alc present, but very pleasant. Raisins in rum. Lots of Amaretto. Tasty, and a treat.

Pours ruby with no head and no carbonation. Aroma: raisins, rum, vanilla, a touch of soil. Taste: perfectly balanced sweetness, barrel rum taste, vanilla. Both aroma and taste are super intensive. This beer clearly goes beyond on what I till now perceived as barley wine. It is really hard to classify.
Reddish brown pour, light head. Sweet flavors of toffee, brown sugar, vanilla and snickerdoodle cookies.

Bottle thanks to Giuseppe. Pours a glowing ruby red. Aroma of vanilla, sherry, dried fruits. Taste of vanilla, caramel, sherry, dried fruits, prune, raisins. Sweet with a slightly bitter finish. Very smooth and balanced.
Pours a caramel brown. Aroma is caramel, toffee and slight vanilla. Taste is caramel, toffee, sweet toffee apple and oak.

bottle at home ... HUGE thanks BenH ... copper ... no head ... soft toffee fruit toffee nose ..massive sweet malts .. soft otffee .llight sherry .. massive toffee fruit .. big oxidisation ... soft sweet fruit ... mellow toffe malt ... ligth bitter .. soft oak
Bottle at craigÂ’s. Pours deep ruby, nose is toffee, vanilla, oak, caramel, taste is similar, sweet, rich, fruity

The aroma is full of chocolate, rum, raosted coffee, caramel, vanilla, oak tree, prunes. The taste is complex with notes of chocolate, liqour, rum coffee and prunes. It has a long finish which new elements appear all the time. Elements such as apple wine appear. It also has a slight of smoke among all other good stuff. It reminds me of mead. Very sweet, just like honey.

Rating #1087, flaske fra Baladin Rom, Ã¥rgang 2011. Brun Ã¸l uden skum. Duft af blommer, dadler, svesker, rosiner, rom, ristet kaffe, karamel,let alkohol, egetrÃ¦, vanille. Smag: karamel, sÃ¸dme, rom, honning, trÃ¦, vanille, Ã¦blevin, lidt alkohol,lidt rÃ¸get, meget kompleks og Ã¦ndrer sig konstant i den meget lange eftersmag. Mild bitterhed. MundfÃ¸lelse let cremet, let tyk, ingen kulsyre.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Appearance: Medium brown, clear. Very low carbonation, basically flat.
Aroma: Lots of fruit, sweet, slight alcohol. Promising.
Taste: Good amounts of fruit and raisins, port, very smooth. Warming alcohol. Lovely, but expensive.
Bought: Les Trentenaires (Fribourg), 50 ml sample, CHF 7.00
Info: 19/5-2015

Draught. Hazy ruby-amber with a small beige head. Smell of dried fruits, caramel, wood, honey, liquor, sherry and raisins. Sweet, very rich flavors of prunes, toffee, vanilla, caramel, overripe fruit and berries, alcoholic but tasty. Medium-full bodied, silky smooth. Great sipper.

Bottled. Pours clear amber with no head. Aroma of wood, plums, figs, rum notes and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and slightly bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and flat carboonation. A nice Barley indeed. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

from bottle at Craft Beer Fest Vienna Tasting Sessions. redish / brown light hazy color. rather oily, almost no head. strong smell of liqueur, malty sweetness, dried fruits, alcoholic, some wooden notes, quite nice smell. full body, very soft and light carbonation, full oily mouthfeel. rather malty sweet taste, liqueur, wood, dried fruits, lightly alcoholic. sweet / alcoholic / fruity finish. quite nice, strong alcoholic.

Sampled from bottle at Craft Bier Fest Wien Tasting Sessions.
Deep copper, clear body, with no head.
Aroma of booze, cognac, rum, barrel, dark and dried fruits, vanilla.
Wonderful, sweet, complex taste of booze, vanilla, chocolate, caramel, dried fruits, some smoke, rum barrel, cognac.
Full, oily mouthfeel, with almost no carbonation.
Finishes alcoholic, warm, astringent, sweet, malty, fruity.

Wow! Very heavy, complex, unique stuff. Not much beer character left, but incredibly tasty. Enjoyed this even a bit more than the XyauyÃ¹ FumÃ©, one of the most extraordinary Barley Wines IÂ’ve had.
-short review- Dark brown with no head. Port wine, toffee and liqueur aroma. Sweet, fruity, port wine finish. Overall: More like port wine than beer.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2015 Bottiglia del 2011 aperta il 4 Aprile 2015.
Color marrone scuro, quasi nero, assenza totale di schiuma.
Al naso note di caramello, legno, toffee e rum; ricorda un vino liquoroso.
Al palato corposa, con note caramellate e liquorose, sul finale si riesce a percepire il luppolo che dÃ  equilibrio alla bevuta facendo sÃ¬ che non risulti troppo stucchevole.
Un capolavoro, ne vale la pena malgrado il costo non accessibile a tutti.

Bottle in a wine glass at Split thy Skull. Pours deep brown with a small head. Aroma of really sweet toffee and brown sugar and caramel, some light hops, and light barrel notes. Flavor the same. Smooth texture. A little too sweet for me.

10 cl sample, 2011 vintage @ Open Baladin, Rome.
Pours clear dark mahogany color with no head. Witty sweet plum on the nose, raisins and some molasses, toffee and caramel, of and letÂ’s add some auto to the mix too. Sweet plum-y flavor, caramel, syrup, malts and molasses, licorice on the finish. Carbonation is almost non-existent. Sweetness overload but fits here nicely, a slow sipping dessert.
8226

UPDATED: APR 4, 2015 
10 cl sample (13.5%) @ Baladin Open, Rome as "XyauyÃ¹ Barrel 2011." 
Aroma has sweet raisins and liquor. Also chocolate tones. Flavour has raisins, sweet sugary tones, licorice and alcohol. Also coffee and truffles. Practically no CO2 at all. The licorice makes this great. Very sweet, very complex, very slow sipper. 10 cl is enough.
On tap Open Baladin Roma. Pours a flat dark purple. Sweet fruits, plums, chestnuts, grapes, wood and rum. It warms you up. Sticky sweet finish. Really good beer but to try, but quite expensive.

Colore giallo antico, limpidissima, senza schiuma. Al nasco emergono dolci sentori liquorosi. In bocca veramente squisita, e assolutamente senza bollicine. LÂ’unica nota negativa, che per me la fa perdere di punteggio Ã¨ che ha un corpo troppo leggero per una barley wine. Si presenta infatti un poÂ’ acquosa per i miei gusti, lÂ’avrei preferita piÃ¹ corposa. Rimane comunque una birra particolarissima, unica nel suo genere (dimenticatevi il solito concetto di birra) e squisita.
Open bottle. Dark copper color. Some head. A slightly thin body. Raisin, prune aroma. Surprising taste -- almost like grappa. First barleywine IÂ’ve ever liked.

From bottle at "Open Baladin" in Rome Italy. Aroma of caramel, sweet tawney port wine, and alcohol. Appears clear reddish brown. Tastes like a sweet caramelly tawny port wine with a somewhat balancing toasty bitterness with some alcohol burn. Palate is a little syrupy, not very fizzy, a lot like a wine. Overall, very nice.

NalaÅ‚em sobie do teku caÅ‚kiem sporÄ… iloÅ›Ä‡ i od razu poczuÅ‚em piÄ™kny aromat wanilii, nieco czekolady i przede wszystkim beczki. Nie wiem, czy akurat po rumie, ale beczki. Bottle... Pours clear and copper with no head, but nicely coats my glass following an energetic swirl. The aroma is rich with hearty molasses, saw palmetto honey and tawny-sweet port. Full-bodied with a syrupy mouthfeel and no carbonation. The flavor is sugary sweet and vinous - maple syrup, dried plum, vintage deep-dark-sweet port and pouch tobacco accompanied by subtle woodiness. Decadent. Enjoyability high - Drinkability low. A digestif. Bottle courtesy of ctipping!

On tap at Open Baladin. Xyauyu rum barrel 2010 100ml pour served in a teku glass - I love that they put their name & logo on the base of the stem very classy. A very dark opaque brown that in the dim light looks like wine. The nose is plum with some coffee & rum. The taste is like liquid maple syrup, sweet malty caramel with light rum, some burn down your throat & warmth spreading out from your stomach. You get oak in the aftertaste and a lingering maple syrup. Delicious.

Poured a clear dark brown with no life. The aroma is sweet malt, boozy alcohol. The flavour is moderate sweet with a rich syrupy sweet fruit malt alcoholic palate. Full bodied and some more with soft carbonation.
Bottle shared. Pours hazy brown with no head. Aroma of butterscotch, toffee, fudge, caramel, booze and oak. Flavour is heavy sweet. Full bodied with flat carbonation.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Big thanks.
no head or carbonation. Deep burgundy pour. Very smooth. Lovely

500ml corked bottle like the one in the picture served in a wine chalice glass.
Bottled purchased in 2012 @ Baggio Bevande (Treviso).
Pours a deep dark amber color with no head formed. Creamy texture. Smell is sweet and woody. Strong notes of caramel and toffee. Concentrated malt notes. Dark dry fruits: raisins and dates. Hints of rum, caramel and chocolate. Low bitterness. No carbonation. Heavy molasses body. Sweet raisins in the aftertaste. Very peculiar and unique brew. If thereÂ’s a brew to define a real "barley wine", thatÂ’s the one.

Sampled from bottle, v2010 rum oak barrel, at Open Baladin, Rome. Dark copper-brown color with no head. Sweet malty aroma, wood, wine, dark fruits, vanilla notes, spicy, chocolate. Taste is sweet and complex like the aroma. Medium oily-sticky body, flat carbonation.

A pretty remarkable beer, extreme depth of flavor and hides itÂ’s alcohol surprisingly well. Rich dark fruits, sherry, caramels, cocoa powder, a bit spicy like a bourbon. Really just a crazy beer, much tastier than Utopias in my opinion.
2011 version. No head. Huge aroma of raisins, malts. Some slight heat notes. Full bodied, not carbonated. Huge sherry notes with dried fruits. Sweet finish, Incredibly good.

Cervesa molt complexa, en aspecte recorda un vi dÂ’Oporto, i en gust i aroma tÃ© tocs dolÃ§os de rom i fruites assecades perÃ² tambÃ© tocs a XerÃ¨s.
Cerveza muy compleja, en aspecto recuerda un vino de Porto, y en sabor y aroma tiene toques dulces de ron i frutas secas pero tambiÃ©n a Jerez.

12th August 2014GBBF Day 1. Bottle share organised by LKS, Cheers! Hazy amber beer, no head. Light palate, no carbonation. Light raisans with lovely mellow rum, sherry and dried fruits. Little toffee - caramel. Modest spice. Light semi dry and soft finish. Delicious! This beer is not intended to be carbonated, so taking that in to account on palate and appearance.

Baladin Bologna. Hazed, dark brown colour. Rum, cognac, dry cocoa, cherry and dried black fruits in aroma. Toffee, cristal deep burned caramel, dark chocolate, cherry chocolates again. Full and oily body, sweet with just hints of barrel sourness. Much better than the basic one.

Spillata direttamente dalla botte @Eurhop 2014.
Ambrata carica liscia.
Calda morbida eterna.

Tasted at Eurohop. Clear Amber color without foam. Amazing aroma, raisins , brown sugar , wood , alcohol. Very sweet , very complex , full bodied. Taste of caramel , raisins , wood , whiskey , brown sugar , maybe cinnamon. Oily mouthfeel. Amazing

At Eurhop festival in Rome-ITALY. Pours clear copper, no foam. Nose: light caramel, wood and whiskey. Mouth: cherries predominant feel (yeah), dry delicate fruit. A jewel!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with the gang at the Great British Beer Festival 2014, Day 1 - London. Vintage 2010. Pours clear amber with really no head. Gorgeous aroma, lots of brown sugar, dates and figs. Hugely sweet and syrupy with liquefied fruits, maple, mild woody alcohol, old berries, currants, ripe cherries. Full bodied, soft, oily and chewy. Warming finish with gooey, ripe dark fruits, more berries, caramel. Excellent stuff. Tons and tons of complexity. I love this stuff.

Bottle shared at GBBF 2014. It pours deep mahogany brown with pretty much no head. The nose is rich, boozy, run, hot cross bun, cinnamon, umami edge, wood, pear, melon, dates and sweet vinous/sherry notes. The taste is slick, vinous, warming, plenty of rum/brandy action, dried fruits...date, fig, prune, brown sugar, banana bread, honey fruits and wood with a warming finish. Full body, fine carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Slick, sticky and warming. Great depth to it. A hell of beverage.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2014 Bottle poured at Tipples Rare and Barrel Aged Beer Tasting. Notes that this was aged in rum barrels. Pours a murky light brown or amber color with no head. Aroma of strong caramel and toffee malts, rum, booze, sweet brown sugar. Flavor is maple sweetness, brown sugar, figs, dates, and light rum fruity spice on the finish. Thick and viscous with essentially no carbonation at all. I came into this expecting to be disappointed but I really enjoyed this one. It can be had in small quantities--drinking much like a port but less harsh--and I assume the beer holds over a few days when recorked. At $47 per bottle, it better hold up as I donÂ’t see any good reason to drink this in one sitting. Recommended if you donÂ’t have to pay full price.

Draught at Open Baladin, Roma. Clear deep amber colour, no head. Aroma is huge, a miasma, toffee, and so fruity--prunes predominately, but also figs, raisins, rum, wooden notes, vanilla. ItÂ’s served too cold but the flavour is so far removed from an American barley wine, it is so Christmassy with clove, caramel, prunes, vanilla, cherries, plums, cake, sweet malt. On the palate, it is the very definition of Â’syrupyÂ’. So fruity! A unique barley wine. IÂ’m rapt in this beer.

Sample at Great British Beer Festival 2014. Thanks to Leighton. Clear Deep amber beer, no head. Rum aroma, vanilla, bready, vinous notes, raisins, and figs, caramel notes, chocoate, some plums. Fruity fig and raisin flavor, caramel, licorice, woody, rum, plums and dades, bisbuits, banana notes, vanilla, some arming alcohol, cocoa notes. Amazing beer!

Bottle share at gbbf thanks Leighton and Neal. Amber caramel colour with viscous texture. Aroma is warming alcohol, rum and raisin, nuts, dried fruits. Flavour is medium sweet, tum smooth barrel and plum fruits. Very well rounded. Palate is smooth, zero carbonation, but coats the tongue. Lingering warming alcohol a raisin rum flavours. Very well done.

Tasted twice at GBBF 2014 once thanks to Leighton, once thanks to the amazing guys behind the Italian bar at the festival. Aroma of dry oloroso sherry. Flavour was similar. Depth of flavour, intensity of flavour, length of flavour all remarkable. Absolutely fantastic beer.
Bottle - Vintage 2010 - Soy sauce, balsamic, ample syrup and vinous. Â Clearish copper with no head. Â Chocolate, vinous, maple syrup, toffee. Â Very nice.

Bottle at GBBF, thanks to Leighton for finding this one 
Clear brown, no head or lacing. Aroma is caramel, woody and fruity. Flavors of rum, caramel and woody  
Very nice

Sampled @ GBBF. Bottle shared. Hazy amber reddish color, no head. Aroma is malts, heavy barrel aging, rhum, liquor. Taste malts, rhum, sweetness, some apricot, warming alcohol. Full body, suitable carbonation. Heavy but nice.
Bottle thanks to Bruce. Pours a cloudy brown with no head. The aroma is figs, dark fruit, booze, strong oak. Thin mouthfeel with nice booze, dark fruit, burnt sugar, caramel. Very good.
Still pour, dark caramel color. Layers upon layers of barleywine complexity. Figs, dates, caramelized sugar, brandy. Fking delicious, thanks Chad!

(500ml bottle) still, deep clear brown. Nose is rich and complex, dates, tea, turbinado sugar, rum raisins, decadent and delicious. Taste of dates, raisins, rich and complex, hints of oxidation that worked well, toasted sugar, such a long sweet finish, delicious.

My Bottom Line:
Luscious raisins, prunes and caramel are enveloped by brandy-rum-port-like allusions, as alcohol and wood blow heat throughout the flavour profile.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-There is no head of foam atop the dark brown.
-The aroma is powerful, a bit rough on the barrel notes perhaps as well.
-Could this one not be oxidized as Terre? Or is it that the barrel presence is stronger and thus hiding some of the oxidation?
-ItÂ’s a little too hot for my liking.
-The lack of carbonation works well with this type of super malty sipper.
-Caramelized oranges are found in the nose. 

Bottle pour at Open Baladin Roma.

Aroma: caramel, dried fruits, caramel, dark malts, vanilla, wood notes.
Appearance: dark brown color, no head.
Taste: almost no bitterness, amazing taste of dried fruits, rum and dark malts, barrel notes with vanilla, smooth and quite sweet.
Palate: full body and no carbonation.
Overall: Amazing and really interesting beer with complex taste.

How: Bottle.
Where: Open Baladin Roma.
Appearance: Dark amber colour with a small off-white head.
Aroma: Dark fruit, plums, raisin, some alcohol, caramel.
Body: Full body, low almost flat carbonation.
Flavour: Dried fruit, raisin, caramel, port, plum.

Brown, no carbonation, no foam. As its barrel aged, itÂ’s aroma has some caramel, a bit of alcohol, dried black plums and figs. Very sweet taste as well. Fruits, a bit of alcohol, flavours coming from the barrel, extremely sweet caramel. It has a quite long presence in the mouth, maple syrup, slight bitterness. Should be good replacement for a port wine, as an aperitif or for longer enjoyment after the meal.
Bottle at Open Baladin Rome. Deep chestnut amber pour, no head. Rich caramel and toffee, super sweet, raisin and dates, rum barrel, light oak, and notes of molasses. Good sipper.

Draught, Open Baladin, Roma. Dark brownish amber looks with no head to speak of. Nose of rum, dark fruits, booze, malts.Flavour was sweet and boozy with notes of brown sugar, wood, ripe fruit, rum and malts. Smooth and full. Great closer of an evening.

Bottle. Dark brown cloudy body no head. Aroma is dark dried fruits with some malts and caramel also alcohol and hints of wood. Taste is sweet malts dark fruits also some sherry and some wood. Aftertaste is very alcoholic in a nice warming way. Very nice one.

Craft bier fest, Vienna. hazy brown color with no head. Very intensive aroma of sweet malt, caramel, dark fruits, raisins, rum, wood. Heavy sweet taste with dried fruits, caramel, vanilla, orange liquor, rum, wood. Strong alcoholic finish. Delight.

Bottle @ Open Baladin, Rome. Pours dark brown, no head, heavy lacings. Flavor is rich malty, caramel, wood, rich dark fruits, plum, prunes, rum, light oxidation, alcohol. Flavor is sweet malty, caramel, portlike, raisin, dates, plums, wood, rum, some alcohol. Full oily body, no carbonation, lond lasting finish with some warming alcohol. Very nice and well balanced barley wine. 060414
For the sake of conversation just the ratings. CanÂ’t help but I just hate smartphones. Sweet vainilla, nuts and sugary finish.

Draft at Eataly. Part of a flight. Red brown color. Carmel color. Carmel taste. Has an offensive smell like rotten plums. Taste was surprisingly good. Carmel candy sweet warm. Enjoyable but not too much of it please.
Aus der Flasche im Open Baladin in Rom. Dunkelbraun kein Schaum kaum KohlensÃ¤ure. Ein Aroma von sÃ¼ÃŸlichen getrochneten FrÃ¼chten - und so schmeckt es auch, fast wie ein Portwein. Sensationell
Complex aroma of malts and alcohol simmilar to brandy. Clear dark amber body with no head. Very sweet but deliciously flowing down the throat with perfectly hidden alcohol. Perfect aftertaste.

"Hand bottled" @Open Baladin, vintage 2009
Dark brown color, not much head. Alcoholic, "dry yeasty", some toffee. Full-bodied. Liquerish palate. Sweet toffee, alcoholic, Madeira wineish. Maybe not the most complex, but enjoyable.

Bottled at Bir&Fud, Roma, august 19th 2013. Dark brown, thick body, minimal offwhite head. Malty aroma with wood, dark fruits toffee, dark chocolate. Taste is strong dark chocolate and caramel vanilla, oak, dark malts, almonds, plums and apricot, very comples, alcohol taste is not disturbing here. A great barley wine.

[18-OCT-2013] Draught at Open Baladin in Rome. Pours like brandy slightly red and sticky, aroma is sweet wit rum, wood, honey, liquor, flavor is tasty, sticky mouthfeel, with toffee, rum, brandy, fruits, round with some acidity, full bodied, very nice

[10/14/13] Draught at Open Baladin in Rome. 13.5%. Lovely deep red amber color. Big malty aroma, somewhat alcoholic, with lots of dark fruits, vinous notes, some wood and caramel. Sweet malty flavor with dark fruits, liqueur, toffee, caramel, a bit of vanilla, cookie notes and warming alcohol. Medium to full-bodied, kinda oily. A nice Barley Wine.

Tap at Open Baladin Roma. Info on the menu was rum barrel. Pours dark amber with no head. Aroma seems rum/raisin with a little alcohol. Near full bodied. Flavor is rum/raisin with brown sugar or treacle. And mild heat. Finishes not towards dry. Delicious sipper. Some oak concentrates with time. Wonderful stuff.

Bottle, bought @ YNWA, Kolding. Pours clear chestnut with no head. Aroma has caramel, chestnuts, sherry, oak, red wine. No carbonation, super oily and fat mouthfeel. Flavour has oak, sweet caramel, sugary, vinious, fresh, plums, figs, rum. Lingering, warming finish. Absolutely lovely.
Nocciola quasi scura melassa piatta ossidata tendenza dolce fruttato frutta matura cacao cioccolato melassa zucchero canna
Tasting at KevinÂ’s. Big alcohol nose. No carbonation. Sweet raisin. Boozy. Dates. Oily. Big beer with brandy like flavors.

In short: A lifeless uber-sweet and uber-boozy brown "beer".
How: From a bottle at Mondial de la BiÃ¨re 2013.
The look: Clear rudty-brown body with no head.
In long: Nose is toasted caramelized pastry, lots of alcohol fumes, wood. A scary sweet and boozy aroma that is a prelude of things to come. In mouth the beer is sticky, syrupy, oily, lifeless. almost no carbonation. Taste is cloying, uber-sweet toffee, a shot of hard-liquor (like cheap rum), cardboard-like oxidation, some wood. I enjoy a big sipper as much as the next guy, IÂ’ve drank multiple bottles of the monstrously sweet Dark Lord, but this Baladin XyauyÃ¹ Barrel was just wrong, I didnÂ’t even finish my 4oz sample. Expensive and totally overrated, and I hate when I express my against-the-grain opinion about a beer and people say I have a superiority complex, screw you people, IÂ’m laughing at you, and IÂ’m laughing at you better than anybody has ever laughed at you.

Glass, 4-ounce, from a bottle, during the Mondial de la biÃ¨re, savoured on May 29 2013; eye: maroon, clear, no effervescence, no head, no lacing; nose: toffee, malt, oxidation, light woody, light fruity; mouth: toffee, malt, oxidation, light woody, light fruity, woody finale with presence of alcohol, full body, not much carbonation, mildly sweet, lightly alcoholic and syrupy texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÃ‡AIS
 
Verre, 4 onces, dÂ’une bouteille, bue lors du Mondial de la biÃ¨re, savourÃ©e le 29 mai 2013; Âœil : marron, limpide, pas dÂ’effervescence, pas de mousse, pas de dentelle; nez : toffee, malt, oxydation, lÃ©ger boisÃ©, lÃ©ger fruitÃ©; bouche : toffee, malt, oxydation, lÃ©ger boisÃ©, lÃ©ger fruitÃ©, finale boisÃ©e avec prÃ©sence dÂ’alcool, corsÃ©e, peu carbonatÃ©e, moyennement sucrÃ©e, texture lÃ©gÃ¨rement alcoolique et sirupeuse; en rÃ©sumÃ© : bien
Sample. Dark brown with no head. Aroma is malt, yeast, dark fruits, wood, toasted and oak. Flavour is malt, yeast, dark fruits, wood, oak, caramel, toasted, toffee with notes of alcohol.

Sample from bottle @ YNWA, Kolding. Clear dark amber without head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit and alcohol. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily. 190713

6/29/13. 500mL bottle shared by nulledge at the epic BA barleywine tasting. IÂ’m glad to try such an expensive bottle! Deep amber red/brown pour with no head - basically flat, as intended. Deep, rich aroma of dark fruits, toffee, butterscotch, molasses, and more... really complex and deep, reminds a bit of sherry or port. Rich flavor as well, lots of sweet fruits, both dark and stone, plenty of caramel, butterscotch, brown sugar, and more. Light barrel and woodiness. Ridiculously smooth and drinkable for the ABV. Really, really good.

Assaggiata al Petit Baladin: nel bicchiere Ã¨ piatta, di colore ramato scuro, schiuma assente, limpida. Birra da meditazione, al naso sentori di vino liquoroso, whiskey lattone. In bocca Ã¨ dolce, alcoolica, calda, si percepisce il caramello insieme a una punta di liquirizia, rabarbaro e toffee. Non ti stanca di berla.
A tous les attraits dÂ’un cafÃ© noisette, vanillÃ© avec une texture huileuse rarement Ã©galÃ©. En petite quantitÃ©.

Bottle - Dark amber/copper in colour. Leather, raisins, sultanas, apricot and malt in the aroma. Sweet and slightly sickly taste with honey, malt, toffee and walnuts detected. One to sample in small doses.

01-MAY-2013, tap @Open Baladin Rome.
Clear brown with no head.
Wonderfull bourbon and malt aroma.
Taste the same with wood, figs, plum, cane sugar.
Fantastic. Unfortunately all flat. Full body, very sweet, very tasty.
Aroma of sugar, brown rum, and brown.  Pours brown with no head.  Taste is pure sugary awesome with caramel, plum and black cherry.  Waaaay sweet.
Dark ruby color. Malt caramel aroma, red fruit, cherry and strawberry. At taste is sweet and full bodied with caramel flavour and warming sensation.

Delle XyauyÃ¹ assaggiate questa Ã¨ quella che mi ha entusiasmato di piÃ¹, lÂ’ho trovata morbidissima al palato, piÃ¹ dolce ma non troppo, molto complessa e assolutamente bevibilissima! Birra da grandi occasioni e da gustare piano e a fondo!

Small pour from bottle. Pours hazy copper with not head and no lacing. Aroma is buttery, bourbon, toffee, wood. Flavor is quite sweet, about the same as the aroma plus graham crackers, prune, raisin, tobacco. Medium body, silky smooth. No carbonation. Well masked ABV.

cereal, caramel, butterscotch, woody.
Barley wine molto particolare. Birra corposa con un gusto deciso e liquoroso. Veramente eccellente.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2016 2013-09-21, bottle at Bistrot Baladin, Milan, vintage 2008, 8-4-9-4-16=41Clean brown color, darker than the regular XyauyÃ¹; Aroma of malt with a hint of spirit and raisins. Smooth mouthfeel, elegant malt flavor, with notes of tobacco, vanilla, raisins, fudge; sweet but not syrupy; low bitterness, but contrasting high alcohol perception; warm final, maybe missing a kick then.Excellent sipper.2012-08-20, corked bottle, courtesy of Jesper, vintage 2008, 7-4-8-4-15=38Hazy dark amber color with a red hue; flat. Sweet and cloying aroma, some candies, some butter, light toffee. Strong body structure, itÂ’s mainly syrupy, with some caramel and toffee flavor, a bit buttery, and with light vanilla oak; sweet, good caramel, harmonious but not deep, alcoholic but without much bitterness; and it can be cloying in the end.

Im Geruch LikÃ¶r, Karamell, Holzfass. Startet sehr weich, malzig. Mitte offeriert Karamellnoten, Marzipan und erinnert an Marsalla. Abgang holzig, Karamellmalz, LikÃ¶r. Minimal alkoholisch. Beeindruckend.

Tasted @Open Baladin, Roma on 27/10/2012.
Pours of a lively, slightly muddy brown color with no head.
Aroma is medium, lots of caramel, dark fruits, a bit of booze.
Just slightly carbonated, taste is very sweet upfront, dark fruits again, combined faint vanilla notes. After a while some woody tones appear and raisins as well.
Could feel a slight taste of alcohol in the back.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 375ml. @ [ The CantillonÂ’s Brewery Quintessence ] at Brasserie Cantillon, 56 Rue Gheude, Brussels, Belgium 1070.Clear medium to dark red amber colour with virtually no head. Aroma is heavy malty, caramel, tobacco, wood, alcohol, light oak. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, wood, tobacco, dried fruit. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat, finish feel is moderate alcoholic. Very nice and well balanced. ;D [20121005]

Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity weak woody dark fruit aroma. Sweetish malty caramel and dark fruit flavor with woody hints. Has a Sweetish malty woody caramel and dark fruit finish.

6/X/2012 - from small bottle (37.5cl?) @ Brouwkwintessens in the Cantillon brewery (Brussels) with the Gentse Biervereniging - rum barrel version - BB: n/a (2012-1111) 
Clear caramel coloured beer, no head. Aroma: lots of caramel, madeira, orange peel, bit spicy, ginger bread, hint of chocolate, some cheese, bit dusty, wood. MF: no carbon, full body. Taste: sweet and sugary in the start, the some alcohol, vanilla, caramel, (candied) orange peel, little sour touch, some walnuts. Aftertaste: vanilla, caramel, sugar, some alcohol, orange peel, bit spicy, ginger.
La barrel aged version della birra di punta di Baladin Ã¨ un dolce nettare di malto e frutta matura. Da degustare con cioccolato e in piccole dosi, vi stupirÃ .

# 1450 Rating. I finally got to try one of these @ Quintessence 2012. A wonderful closer after a long list of stellar sours, this went perfectly paired with some chocolate caviar - this was highly impressive stuff. Got a cognac sized pour of this one - Italian wine / beer styled bottle in a cardboard tube similar to those that whiskeyÂ’s use. Fine presentation going on here - bottle specifies as well as one of brewery gentlemen that this aged on Rum barrels. Looks like brandy when poured, obviously this pours completely flat, zero head formation, a dark copper amber. Smell is sweet, like some liquor, sweet caramel, rum, wood, vanilla, dark fruits completely ingrained into the previous, light booze. Slick, oily, liqueur, with caramel, toffee mixed in, barrel, brown sugar, wood, vanilla, dark fruits, rum, the sweetness hides the alcohol - plus given the small pour, you take little sips of this stuff. Incredibly - like some kind of really fine liqueur - this something totally different. I liked the Terre actually even a bit more.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2012 Bottle sample @ Cantillon Quintessence 2012.

This version specifically RUMbarrel aged . If the Terre looks as cognac, this one looks as Armenian brandy. Headless, of course. Wine grapes, extremely vinous and indeed rum. Vanilla, but also a bit earthy. Sweet, alcoholheat - even interfering in the flavour - chocolate, rum, overripe bananas, baba au rhum or (Italian) liqueur icecream. Sticky, viscous, heat; long, long-lasting flavours. Probably the best XyauyÃ¹ IÂ’ve tasted so far.
2012.10.06 - sample at brewery Cantillon (brouwkwintessens) - brown beer - aroma coffee and cognac - taste coffee, alcohol, cognac, inflamed sensation in my throat, notes of sweet

From the barrel at Open Baladin, Roma - 02/10/12.
Clear chestnut brown/amber still in appearance like a fine brandy with no head.
Big old whisky nose, wood and medicinal tones.
Tastes of dark toffee, whisky, dates, prunes, dark fruit and wood.
Smooth as in the feel, superb. Full bodied with little carbonation, as good as it gets on the palate.
Overall a top draw barley wine!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: A: caramel, peach, grapes, no foam. A: dark amber T: sweet wine. p: fb. O: 19/20

Botella, gracias a yespr. Amber brown. Sweet dark malty caramel dark fruity alco aroma. Good mouthfeel. Sweet indeed the flavour with dark malt and dark fruit, caramel and alcohol. Quite sweet warming brew.

Bottle at yespr.
Clear orange-brown coloured with no head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel and dried fruits with notes of alcohol.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel and dried fruits with notes of port wine.
Sweet and warming alcoholic finish.

clear dark brown, no head.
aroma is boozy, sort of woody.
flavor is sweet, malty, sweet caramelly,

Bottled. Dark burgundy coloured. Dense light brown head. Aroma of ripe fruits, spice, alcohol, sweetness. Flavour of syrupy sweetness, alcohol, ripe fruits, spice. Medium to full bodied. Ends syrupy sweet and fruity. very alcoholdense.
Bottled. An amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of alcohol, and maltl. The flavopr sweet sweet with notes of alcohol, and malt, leading to a dry finish.

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Bottle exactly as the shown label: "Riserva Teo Musso - 2008". Pours a clear warm amber with no head. Very complex vanillaish aroma, overripe oxidized fruit. Rich body, completely flat, caramel, overripe fruit, noble rot, vanilla and a warming alcohol finish. Lovely and very complex. 200812

50 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden orange to brown with a small to fully gone head. Aroma is ffruity and dark toasted malty flavoured. Sweet, toasted malty and sweet caramelish. Smooth and sweet finish. Lingering sweet and caramelish far finish.

An after beer from an Italian beer seminar at the 3rd Annual Craft Beer Crawl in Downtown LA.  Very thick.  Pours a deep, dark brown .  Viscous and quite sugary.  Almost syrupy.  Interesting but a little goes a long way.
